children.value: Launches a browser with a tab. The browser will be closed when the parent node.js process is closed.
launches the browser in headless mode by default, but when
it launches the browser in headful mode.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await openBrowser({headless: false})
await openBrowser()
await openBrowser({args:['--window-size=1440,900']})
await openBrowser({args: [
     '--disable-gpu',
      '--disable-dev-shm-usage',
      '--disable-setuid-sandbox',
      '--no-first-run',
      '--no-sandbox',
      '--no-zygote']}) # These are recommended args that has to be passed when running in docker

tags.title: param
tags.description: eg. {headless: true|false, args:['--window-size=1440,900']}
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to open browser in headless/headful mode.
tags.name: options.headless

tags.title: param
tags.description: Args to open chromium. Refer https://peter.sh/experiments/chromium-command-line-switches/ for values.
tags.name: options.args

tags.title: param
tags.description: Remote host to connect to.
tags.name: options.host

tags.title: param
tags.description: Remote debugging port, if not given connects to any open port.
tags.name: options.port

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to ignore certificate errors.
tags.name: options.ignoreCertificateErrors

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to run each command after a delay. Useful to observe what is happening in the browser.
tags.name: options.observe

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to modify delay time for observe mode. Accepts value in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.observeTime

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to dump IO from browser.
tags.name: options.dumpio

examples.description:
await openBrowser({headless: false})
await openBrowser()
await openBrowser({args:['--window-size=1440,900']})
await openBrowser({args: [
     '--disable-gpu',
      '--disable-dev-shm-usage',
      '--disable-setuid-sandbox',
      '--no-first-run',
      '--no-sandbox',
      '--no-zygote']}) # These are recommended args that has to be passed when running in docker

children.value: Option to open browser in headless/headful mode.
Remote debugging port, if not given connects to any open port.
Option to run each command after a delay. Useful to observe what is happening in the browser.
Option to modify delay time for observe mode. Accepts value in milliseconds.
Option to dump IO from browser.
Closes the browser and along with all of its tabs.

tags.title: example
tags.description: await closeBrowser()

examples.description: await closeBrowser()

children.value: Gives CRI client object (a wrapper around Chrome DevTools Protocol). Refer
This is useful while writing plugins or if use some API of
Allows switching between tabs using URL or page title.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
# switch using URL
await switchTo('https://taiko.gauge.org/')
# switch using Title
await switchTo('Taiko')
# switch using regex URL
await switchTo(/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/)
# switch using regex Title
await switchTo(/Go*gle/)

tags.title: param
tags.description: URL/Page title of the tab to switch.
tags.name: targetUrl

examples.description:
# switch using URL
await switchTo('https://taiko.gauge.org/')
# switch using Title
await switchTo('Taiko')
# switch using regex URL
await switchTo(/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/)
# switch using regex Title
await switchTo(/Go*gle/)

children.value: URL/Page title of the tab to switch.
Add interceptor for the network call. Helps in overriding request or to mock response of a network call.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
# case 1: block URL :
await intercept(url)
# case 2: mockResponse :
await intercept(url, {mockObject})
# case 3: override request :
await intercept(url, (request) => {request.continue({overrideObject})})
# case 4: redirect always :
await intercept(url, redirectUrl)
# case 5: mockResponse based on request :
await intercept(url, (request) => { request.respond({mockResponseObject}) })
# case 6: block URL twice:
await intercept(url, undefined, 2)
# case 7: mockResponse only 3 times :
await intercept(url, {mockObject}, 3)

tags.title: param
tags.description: request URL to intercept
tags.name: requestUrl

tags.title: param
tags.description: action to be done after interception. For more examples refer to https://github.com/getgauge/taiko/issues/98#issuecomment-42024186
tags.name: option

tags.title: param
tags.description: number of times the request has to be intercepted . Optional parameter
tags.name: count

examples.description:
# case 1: block URL :
await intercept(url)
# case 2: mockResponse :
await intercept(url, {mockObject})
# case 3: override request :
await intercept(url, (request) => {request.continue({overrideObject})})
# case 4: redirect always :
await intercept(url, redirectUrl)
# case 5: mockResponse based on request :
await intercept(url, (request) => { request.respond({mockResponseObject}) })
# case 6: block URL twice:
await intercept(url, undefined, 2)
# case 7: mockResponse only 3 times :
await intercept(url, {mockObject}, 3)

children.value: action to be done after interception. For more examples refer to
number of times the request has to be intercepted . Optional parameter

tags.description:
await emulateNetwork("Offline")
await emulateNetwork("Good2G")

tags.title: param
tags.description: 'GPRS','Regular2G','Good2G','Good3G','Regular3G','Regular4G','DSL','WiFi, Offline'
tags.name: networkType

await emulateNetwork("Good2G")

children.value: Launches a new tab. If url is provided, the new tab is opened with the url loaded.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await openTab('https://taiko.gauge.org/')
await openTab() # opens a blank tab.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Url of page to open in newly created tab.
tags.name: targetUrl

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after the reload. Default navigation timeout is 5000 milliseconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click. Accepts value in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: time to wait to check for occurrence of page load events. Accepts value in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.waitForStart

tags.title: param
tags.description: Page load events to implicitly wait for. Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']]
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

examples.description:
await openTab('https://taiko.gauge.org/')
await openTab() # opens a blank tab.

Closes the given tab with given URL or closes current tab.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
# Closes the current tab.
await closeTab()
# Closes all the tabs with Title 'Open Source Test Automation Framework | Gauge'.
await closeTab('Open Source Test Automation Framework | Gauge')
# Closes all the tabs with URL 'https://gauge.org'.
await closeTab('https://gauge.org')
# Closes all the tabs with Regex Title 'Go*gle'
await closeTab(/Go*gle/)
# Closes all the tabs with Regex URL '/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/'
await closeTab(/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/)

tags.title: param
tags.description: URL/Page title of the tab to close.
tags.name: targetUrl

examples.description:
# Closes the current tab.
await closeTab()
# Closes all the tabs with Title 'Open Source Test Automation Framework | Gauge'.
await closeTab('Open Source Test Automation Framework | Gauge')
# Closes all the tabs with URL 'https://gauge.org'.
await closeTab('https://gauge.org')
# Closes all the tabs with Regex Title 'Go*gle'
await closeTab(/Go*gle/)
# Closes all the tabs with Regex URL '/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/'
await closeTab(/http(s?):\/\/(www?).google.(com|co.in|co.uk)/)

children.value: URL/Page title of the tab to close.

children.value: Sets a cookie with the given cookie data. It may overwrite equivalent cookie if it already exists.

tags.description:
await setCookie("CSRFToken","csrfToken", {url: "http://the-internet.herokuapp.com"})
await setCookie("CSRFToken","csrfToken", {domain: "herokuapp.com"})

tags.title: param
tags.description: Cookie name.
tags.name: name

tags.title: param
tags.description: Cookie value.
tags.name: value

tags.title: param
tags.description: sets cookie with the URL.
tags.name: options.url

tags.title: param
tags.description: sets cookie with the exact domain.
tags.name: options.domain

tags.title: param
tags.description: sets cookie with the exact path.
tags.name: options.path

tags.title: param
tags.description: True if cookie to be set is secure.
tags.name: options.secure

tags.title: param
tags.description: True if cookie to be set is http-only.
tags.name: options.httpOnly

tags.title: param
tags.description: Represents the cookie's 'SameSite' status: Refer https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies.
tags.name: options.sameSite

tags.title: param
tags.description: UTC time in seconds, counted from January 1, 1970. eg: 2019-02-16T16:55:45.529Z
tags.name: options.expires

examples.description:
await setCookie("CSRFToken","csrfToken", {url: "http://the-internet.herokuapp.com"})
await setCookie("CSRFToken","csrfToken", {domain: "herokuapp.com"})

sets cookie with the exact path.
True if cookie to be set is secure.
True if cookie to be set is http-only.
UTC time in seconds, counted from January 1, 1970. eg: 2019-02-16T16:55:45.529Z
Deletes browser cookies with matching name and URL or domain/path pair. If cookie name is not given or empty, all browser cookies are deleted.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await deleteCookies() # clears all browser cookies
await deleteCookies("CSRFToken", {url: "http://the-internet.herokuapp.com"})
await deleteCookies("CSRFToken", {domain: "herokuapp.com"})

tags.title: param
tags.description: Cookie name.
tags.name: cookieName

tags.title: param
tags.description: deletes all the cookies with the given name where domain and path match provided URL. eg: https://google.com
tags.name: options.url

tags.title: param
tags.description: deletes only cookies with the exact domain. eg: google.com
tags.name: options.domain

tags.title: param
tags.description: deletes only cookies with the exact path. eg: Google/Chrome/Default/Cookies/..
tags.name: options.path

examples.description:
await deleteCookies() # clears all browser cookies
await deleteCookies("CSRFToken", {url: "http://the-internet.herokuapp.com"})
await deleteCookies("CSRFToken", {domain: "herokuapp.com"})

children.value: deletes all the cookies with the given name where domain and path match provided URL. eg:
deletes only cookies with the exact domain. eg: google.com
deletes only cookies with the exact path. eg: Google/Chrome/Default/Cookies/..

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await getCookies()
await getCookies({urls:['https://the-internet.herokuapp.com']})

tags.title: param
tags.description: The list of URLs for which applicable cookies will be fetched
tags.name: options.urls

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Array of cookie objects

examples.description:

Fetches an element with the given selector, scrolls it into view if needed, and then clicks in the center of the element. If there's no element matching selector, the method throws an error.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await click('Get Started')
await click(link('Get Started'))
await click({x : 170, y : 567})

tags.title: param
tags.description: A selector to search for element to click / coordinates of the elemets to click on. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be clicked.
tags.name: selector

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 30 seconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: `left`, `right`, or `middle`.
tags.name: options.button

tags.title: param
tags.description: Number of times to click on the element.
tags.name: options.clickCount

tags.title: param
tags.description: Number of elements to loop through to match the element with given selector.
tags.name: options.elementsToMatch

tags.title: param
tags.description: Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

tags.title: param
tags.description: time to wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.waitForStart

examples.description:
await click('Get Started')
await click(link('Get Started'))
await click({x : 170, y : 567})

children.value: A selector to search for element to click / coordinates of the elemets to click on. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be clicked.

Number of times to click on the element.
Number of elements to loop through to match the element with given selector.
time to wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.

Fetches the source element with given selector and moves it to given destination selector or moves for given distance. If there's no element matching selector, the method throws an error.

tags.name: distance

await dragAndDrop($("work"),{up:10,down:10,left:10,right:10})

children.value: Element for dropping the dragged element
Distance to be moved from position of source element

await write('admin', 'Username:')
await write('admin')

Prevent given text from being written to log output.
Clears the value of given selector. If no selector is given clears the current active element.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await clear()
await clear(textBox({placeholder:'Email'}))

tags.title: param
tags.description: A selector to search for element to clear. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be cleared.
tags.name: selector

tags.title: param
tags.description: Click options.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after clear. Default navigation timeout is 30 seconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.waitForStart

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.description: Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

await clear()
await clear(textBox({placeholder:'Email'}))

wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.

Highlights the given element on the page by drawing a red rectangle around it. This is useful for debugging purposes.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await highlight('Get Started')
await highlight(link('Get Started'))

tags.description: A selector of an element to highlight. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be highlighted.
tags.name: selector

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors

examples.description:
await highlight('Get Started')
await highlight(link('Get Started'))

children.value: A selector of an element to highlight. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be highlighted.
Performs the given mouse action on the given coordinates. This is useful in performing actions on canvas.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await mouseAction('press', {x:0,y:0})
await mouseAction('move', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction('release', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction($("#elementID"),'press', {x:0,y:0})
await mouseAction($(".elementClass"),'move', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction($("testxpath"),'release', {x:9,y:9})

tags.title: param
tags.description: Action to be performed on the canvas
tags.name: action

tags.title: param
tags.description: Coordinates of a point on canvas to perform the action.
tags.name: coordinates

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 30 seconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

tags.title: param
tags.description: time to wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.
tags.name: options.waitForStart

examples.description:
await mouseAction('press', {x:0,y:0})
await mouseAction('move', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction('release', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction($("#elementID"),'press', {x:0,y:0})
await mouseAction($(".elementClass"),'move', {x:9,y:9})
await mouseAction($("testxpath"),'release', {x:9,y:9})

children.value: Action to be performed on the canvas
Coordinates of a point on canvas to perform the action.
Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 30 seconds, to override pass

time to wait for navigation to start. Accepts time in milliseconds.

children.value: Captures a screenshot of the page. Appends timeStamp to filename if no filepath given.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await screenshot()
await screenshot({path : 'screenshot.png'})
await screenshot({fullPage:true})
await screenshot(text('Images', toRightOf('gmail')))

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Promise which resolves to buffer with captured screenshot if {encoding:'base64'} given.

examples.description:
await screenshot()
await screenshot({path : 'screenshot.png'})
await screenshot({fullPage:true})
await screenshot(text('Images', toRightOf('gmail')))

children.value: Promise which resolves to buffer with captured screenshot if {encoding:'base64'} given.
Fetches an element with the given selector, scrolls it into view if needed, and then taps on the element. If there's no element matching selector, the method throws an error.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await tap('Gmail')
await tap(link('Gmail'))

tags.title: param
tags.description: - Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 15 seconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await tap('Gmail')
await tap(link('Gmail'))

children.value: Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 15 seconds, to override pass
lets you identify elements on the web page via XPath or CSS selector and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await highlight($(`//*[text()='text']`))
await $(`//*[text()='text']`).exists()
$(`#id`,near('username'),below('login'))

tags.title: param
tags.description: XPath or CSS selector.
tags.name: selector

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await highlight($(`//*[text()='text']`))
await $(`//*[text()='text']`).exists()
$(`#id`,near('username'),below('login'))

children.value:
lets you identify an image on a web page. This is done via the image's alt text or attribute and value pairs
and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await click(image('alt'))
await image('alt').exists()
await image({id:'imageId'}).exists()
await image({id:'imageId'},below('text')).exists()
await image(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: The image's alt text.
tags.name: alt

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await click(image('alt'))
await image('alt').exists()
await image({id:'imageId'}).exists()
await image({id:'imageId'},below('text')).exists()
await image(below('text')).exists()

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
lets you identify a link on a web page with text or attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await click(link('Get Started'))
await link('Get Started').exists()
await link({id:'linkId'}).exists()
await link({id:'linkId'},below('text')).exists()
await link(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: The link text.
tags.name: text

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await click(link('Get Started'))
await link('Get Started').exists()
await link({id:'linkId'}).exists()
await link({id:'linkId'},below('text')).exists()
await link(below('text')).exists()

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
lets you identify a list item (HTML
element) on a web page with label or attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await highlight(listItem('Get Started'))
await listItem('Get Started').exists()
await listItem({id:'listId'}).exists()
await listItem({id:'listItemId'},below('text')).exists()
await listItem(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: The label of the list item.
tags.name: label

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await highlight(listItem('Get Started'))
await listItem('Get Started').exists()
await listItem({id:'listId'}).exists()
await listItem({id:'listItemId'},below('text')).exists()
await listItem(below('text')).exists()

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
The label of the list item.

lets you identify a button on a web page with label or attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
lets you identify a file input field on a web page either with label or with attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await attach('file.txt', to(fileField('Please select a file:')))
await fileField('Please select a file:').exists()
await fileField({'id':'file'}).exists()
await fileField({id:'fileFieldId'},below('text')).exists()
await fileField(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: The label (human-visible name) of the file input field.
tags.name: label

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await attach('file.txt', to(fileField('Please select a file:')))
await fileField('Please select a file:').exists()
await fileField({'id':'file'}).exists()
await fileField({id:'fileFieldId'},below('text')).exists()
await fileField(below('text')).exists()

children.value: The label (human-visible name) of the file input field.
Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}

This {@tableCell selector} lets you identify a table cell
on a web page with row and column and row values as options and locating table using proximity selectors,
or table labels.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
tableCell({row:1, col:1}, "Table Caption")
tableCell({id:'myColumn'}).text()
tableCell({row:1,col:3}).text()
highlight(tableCell({row:2, col:3}, "Table Caption"))
highlight(text("Table Cell 2",above(tableCell({row:2, col:2}, "Table Caption"))))
highlight(text("Table Cell 1",near(tableCell({row:1, col:1}, "Table Caption"))))
click(link(above(tableCell({row:4,col:1},"Table Caption"))))
highlight(link(above(tableCell({row:4,col:1},above("Code")))))

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pair of row and column like {row:1, col:3}
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: The Table Caption or any Table Header or Table ID.
tags.name: label

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
tableCell({row:1, col:1}, "Table Caption")
tableCell({id:'myColumn'}).text()
tableCell({row:1,col:3}).text()
highlight(tableCell({row:2, col:3}, "Table Caption"))
highlight(text("Table Cell 2",above(tableCell({row:2, col:2}, "Table Caption"))))
highlight(text("Table Cell 1",near(tableCell({row:1, col:1}, "Table Caption"))))
click(link(above(tableCell({row:4,col:1},"Table Caption"))))
highlight(link(above(tableCell({row:4,col:1},above("Code")))))

children.value: Pair of row and column like {row:1, col:3}
Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
The Table Caption or any Table Header or Table ID.

lets you identify a text field(input (with type text, password, url, search, number, email, tel), textarea and contenteditable fields)
on a web page either with label or with attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await focus(textBox('Username:'))
await textBox('Username:').exists()
await textBox({id:'textBoxId'},below('text')).exists()
await textBox(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: The label (human-visible name) of the text field.
tags.name: label

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:
await focus(textBox('Username:'))
await textBox('Username:').exists()
await textBox({id:'textBoxId'},below('text')).exists()
await textBox(below('text')).exists()

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
The label (human-visible name) of the text field.

lets you identify a dropDown on a web page either with label or with attribute and value pairs and proximity selectors.
Any value can be selected using value or text or index of the options.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
await dropDown('Vehicle:').select('Car')
await dropDown('Vehicle:').select({index:'0'}) - index starts from 0
await dropDown('Vehicle:').value()
await dropDown('Vehicle:').exists()
await dropDown({id:'dropDownId'},below('text')).exists()
await dropDown(below('text')).exists()

tags.title: param
tags.description: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
tags.name: attrValuePairs

tags.title: param
tags.description: The label (human-visible name) of the drop down.
tags.name: label

tags.title: param
tags.description: Proximity selectors
tags.name: args

examples.description:

await dropDown('Vehicle:').select({index:'0'}) - index starts from 0
await dropDown('Vehicle:').value()
await dropDown('Vehicle:').exists()
await dropDown({id:'dropDownId'},below('text')).exists()
await dropDown(below('text')).exists()

children.value: Pairs of attribute and value like {"id":"name","class":"class-name"}
The label (human-visible name) of the drop down.

await checkBox(below('text')).exists()

An element is considered nearer to a reference element,
only if the element offset is lesser than the 30px of the reference element in any direction.
Default offset is 30px to override set options = {offset:50}

tags.title: example
tags.description:

await click(link("Block", near("name", {offset: 50}))

tags.title: param
tags.description: Web element selector.
tags.name: selector

examples.description:
await click(link("Block", near("name"))
await click(link("Block", near("name", {offset: 50}))

tags.title: param
tags.description:
callback method to execute on the element or root HTML element when selector is not provided.
NOTE : In callback, we can access only inline css not the one which are define in css files.
tags.name: callback

tags.title: param
tags.description: options.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 15 seconds, to override pass `{ navigationTimeout: 10000 }` in `options` parameter.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

tags.title: param
tags.description: wait for navigation to start. Accepts value in milliseconds
tags.name: options.waitForStart

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: Arguments to be passed to the provided callback.
tags.name: options.args

tags.title: param
tags.description: Events available to wait for ['DOMContentLoaded', 'loadEventFired', 'networkAlmostIdle', 'networkIdle', 'firstPaint', 'firstContentfulPaint', 'firstMeaningfulPaint']]
tags.name: options.waitForEvents

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Object with return value of callback given

children.value: callback method to execute on the element or root HTML element when selector is not provided.
NOTE : In callback, we can access only inline css not the one which are define in css files.
Wait for navigation after the click. Default navigation timeout is 15 seconds, to override pass
wait for navigation to start. Accepts value in milliseconds
Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
Arguments to be passed to the provided callback.
Object with return value of callback given
This function is used to improve the readability. It simply returns the parameter passed into it.

tags.title: example
tags.description: await attach('c:/abc.txt', to('Please select a file:'))

examples.description: await attach('c:/abc.txt', to('Please select a file:'))

children.value: This function is used to improve the readability. It simply returns the parameter passed into it.

tags.title: example
tags.description: await write("user", into('Username:'))

examples.description: await write("user", into('Username:'))

tags.title: example
tags.description: prompt('Message', async () => await accept('Something'))

examples.description: prompt('Message', async () => await accept('Something'))

tags.title: example
tags.description: prompt('Message', async () => await dismiss())

examples.description: prompt('Message', async () => await dismiss())

tags.title: example
tags.description: setConfig( { observeTime: 3000});

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to modify delay time in milliseconds for observe mode.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Navigation timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after performing openTab, goto, reload, goBack, goForward, click, write, clear, press and evaluate.
tags.name: options.navigationTimeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to modify delay time in milliseconds to retry the search of element existence.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to modify timeout in milliseconds while retrying the search of element existence.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Wait for navigation after performing goto, click, doubleClick, rightClick, write, clear, press and evaluate.
tags.name: options.waitForNavigation

Removes interceptor for the provided URL or all interceptors if no URL is specified

tags.title: example
tags.description:
# case 1: Remove intercept for a single  URL :
await clearIntercept(requestUrl)
# case 2: Reset intercept for all URL :
await clearIntercept()

tags.title: param
tags.description: request URL to intercept. Optional parameters
tags.name: requestUrl

examples.description:
# case 1: Remove intercept for a single  URL :
await clearIntercept(requestUrl)
# case 2: Reset intercept for all URL :
await clearIntercept()

children.value: request URL to intercept. Optional parameters

tags.title: example
returns
tags.description: The URL of the current window.

children.value: The URL of the current window.
This function is used to wait for number of milliseconds given or a given element or a given condition.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
waitFor(5000)
waitFor("1 item in cart")
waitFor("Order Created", 2000)
waitFor(async () => !(await $("loading-text").exists()))

tags.title: param
tags.description: Element/condition to wait for
tags.name: element

tags.title: param
tags.description: Time to wait. default to 10s
tags.name: time

examples.description:
waitFor(5000)
waitFor("1 item in cart")
waitFor("Order Created", 2000)
waitFor(async () => !(await $("loading-text").exists()))

children.value: Starts a REPL when taiko is invoked as a runner with

tags.title: example
tags.description:
import { repl } from 'taiko/recorder';
await repl();

tags.title: example
tags.description: taiko --load script.js

examples.description:
import { repl } from 'taiko/recorder';
await repl();
taiko --load script.js

Identifies an element on the page.

tags.title: callback
tags.description: selector

tags.title: example
tags.description:
link('Sign in')
button('Get Started')
$('#id')
text('Home')

tags.title: param
tags.description: Text to identify the element.
tags.name: text

examples.description:
link('Sign in')
button('Get Started')
$('#id')
text('Home')

children.value: Lets you perform relative HTML element searches.

tags.title: callback
tags.description: relativeSelector

tags.title: example
tags.description:
near('Home')
toLeftOf('Sign in')
toRightOf('Get Started')
above('Sign in')
below('Home')
link('Sign In',near("Home"),toLeftOf("Sign Out")) - Multiple selectors can be used to perform relative search

tags.title: param
tags.description: Web element selector.
tags.name: selector

examples.description:
near('Home')
toLeftOf('Sign in')
toRightOf('Get Started')
above('Sign in')
below('Home')
link('Sign In',near("Home"),toLeftOf("Sign Out")) - Multiple selectors can be used to perform relative search

children.value: Represents a relative HTML element search. This is returned by

tags.title: example
tags.description:
above('username')
near('Get Started')

above('username')
near('Get Started')

children.value: Wrapper object of all found elements. This list mimics the behaviour of
by exposing similar methods. The call of these methods gets delegated to first element wrapper.
which gives the actual list of element wrappers. It can be used to loop over the elements.

tags.title: property
tags.description: @private {function} get - Deprecated from version `1.0.3`. DOM element getter. Implicitly wait for the element to appears with timeout of 10 seconds.
tags.name: null

tags.title: property
tags.description: @private {function} elements - DOM element wrapper getter. Implicitly wait for the element to appears with timeout of 10 seconds. Returns a list of element wrappers found.
tags.name: null

tags.title: property
tags.description: Checks existence for element.  Accepts `(retryInterval, retryTimeout)` parameters (defaults to global settings).
tags.name: exists

tags.title: property
tags.description: Describes the operation performed.
tags.name: description

tags.title: property
tags.description: Gives innerText of the first element found.
tags.name: text

tags.title: example

children.value: Gives innerText of the first element found.
Wrapper object for the element present on the web page. Extra methods are available based on the element type.
for input field, fileField and text field.

tags.title: property
tags.description: Checks existence for element.  Accepts `(retryInterval, retryTimeout)` parameters (defaults to global settings).
tags.name: exists

tags.title: property
tags.description: Describes the operation performed.
tags.name: description

tags.title: property
tags.description: Gives innerText of the first element found.
tags.name: text

tags.title: example
tags.description:
link('google').exists()
link('google').exists(1000)
link('google').description

link('google').exists(1000)
